nl: Suppose $p \in \mathcal{P}(\mathbf{C})$ has degree $m$. Prove that $p$ has $m$ distinct roots if and only if $p$ and its derivative $p^{\prime}$ have no roots in common.
lean:
∀ (p : Polynomial ℂ), p.degree = @card (rootSet p ℂ) (rootSetFintype p ℂ) ↔
  Disjoint
  (@card (rootSet (derivative p) ℂ) (rootSetFintype (derivative p) ℂ))
  (@card (rootSet p ℂ) (rootSetFintype p ℂ))
candidate: ∀ [Field ℂ] {p : Polynomial ℂ} (h : p.degree = m), p.roots.toFinset.card = m ↔ (p.roots ∩ p.derivative.roots) = ∅
imports:
import Mathlib

open Fintype Complex Polynomial LinearMap FiniteDimensional Module Module.End
open scoped BigOperators
